data.title: The Best Steaks
data.text: The first time we ate here it was because we had a group-on, but the prices were actually very reasonable for the location. My expectations were very high but I was very surprised. This is the best steak I've ever had and it is well worth the drive.

data.title: Fabulous dining with impeccable service.
data.text: We were 9 people looking for a nice dinner recently attending a conference at the Hyatt hotel. Walking up Pine Avenue in Long Beach we stumbled on this Argentinian restaurant called the Gaucho Grill. The owner Enrique warmly received us and provided impeccable and friendly service throughout the courses of our dinner. The fare is heavily weighted to grilled meat and with good reason its excellent and spiced just right. Several bottles of  reasonably priced cab sauvignon helped make the night a memorable one. This is a fabulous dining experience and highly recommended.

data.title: Of course...steak!
data.text: I love this place. The ambiance is great and if you go, I'd definitely recommend getting the steak with chimichurri and mashed potatoes.Just an Argentine classic!

data.title: A NEW FAVOURITE
data.text:
Wow, talk about customer service.  Right from the moment we walked in we were treated like royalty.  The staff are engaged, friendly and brimming with good recommendations!

The empendas hit 10 on the wow meter.  Wonderfully light and tasty pastry.  The spinach and cheese filling was to die for.  The mozzarella caprese was good.  I added their amazing chimmichuri sauce (for the fresh dinner rolls) to it and that took it the next level.  The skirt steak was cooked to perfection and one didn't have to 'chew' as it was soooo tender.  The garlic french fries were outstanding (be sure to ask for extra garlic) and the side salad was light, crisp with their house dressing.  The shrimp risotto was another hit.  The risotto was light and tasty, i.e. not starchy, and the shrimp were butterflied an cooked perfectly.  Dessert was an Argentinian crepe, filled with a evil caramel sauce and a plop of ice cream for contrast.  Wow.
Fantastic selection of Malbecs to boot.  Can't wait to go back.

data.title: First Venture
data.text: Went to Argentine Steakhouse in Playa Del Carmen with my son and we went crazy for everything. So had to try this new Gaucho Grill in Downey-yes Downey. Great food, service, wine. 10+😍 You will miss a fabulous treat if you don't head into Gaucho Grill in Downey!!!

data.title: Empanadas and sangria!!
data.text:
We went to Gaucho Grill with one of those expired coupons that allow us to have $30 in food for $15. The website said the Long Beach location has happy hour every day. When we got there, they told us they DON'T have happy hour on Saturday. When we explained about the website, they honored happy hour prices. Naturally, we left a big tip.

Empanadas are amazing, and the sangria was good. Hubby had white sangria, I had red. The red was definitely better, and each of our glasses had boozy fruit on the bottom (YUM). 

Dinner entrees are pricy, but I have heard the food is excellent.

data.title: "A lot of food!"
data.text: We ate on the patio, which was a nice setting, and had empanadas and Parrillada which was supposed to serve 2-3 but could easily serve 4-5. It was a great value for the amount of meat and sides in the portion. We enjoyed our cocktails, Champagne Mojito's and Sangria, but did not have room to try dessert.

data.title: Authentic Food, Nice Staff
data.text:
I recently went to Gaucho Grill with various colleagues. We had empanadas as starters, excellent and very savory. They tasted authentic (I've been to Argentina various times), and that was confirmed also by a friend from Argentina that joint us for a while.

Our group has skirt steaks and lamb chops. All dishes were well prepared.

Good wine list, although slightly pricey (well, we are in California after all).

The service was very friendly an accommodating.

data.title: Good Argentinian Food
data.text: very authentic - friendly, and attentive staff - good appetizers, good steak.  Full bar, but a limited wine list - they were very busy the night we were there, and our meals came out a little late - owner brought over complimentary wine and champagne to apologize - very nice touch.  The place is a bit small, tables are crowded together, so it is not a place for an intimate dinner, but certainly a good place for family and friends to enjoy a meal.  Loved the desserts!

data.title: ************** Inappropriate behavior by owner ****************
data.text:
I have given one star because i cannot give -1 to this restaurant.

The most dissappointing thing about this restaurant is that, the owner doesn't show mininum respect to his customers.

1. Inappropriate behavior by owner - My wife didn't like the burger that we ordered. So, she just didn't eat it. And the waiter stopped by and kept asking if she like the burger or not. She just said, she is not feeling like eating it and so said take it easy. Just because, waiter asked about the food, she commented on the burger. But the waiter tried to show curtesy by offering alternate team from the menu and took away the burger from our table.

With in a minute, the owner came back with the same burger plate and insisted her to explain why she didn't like the burger. She then, said - she just didn't like the burger. But he kept investigated her by asking about each and every item in the burger. He started removing every piece from the burger with he knife and asked her which part she didn't like. It was like a police investigation. 

First of all, we didn't say anything about the burger we didn't like. But It was waiter who insisted in giving substitute for the burger. And we were ready to pay for the entire bill. 

They only came, they offered alternate item from menu and finally they insulted us. 

2. Drinks - awful 
We order margarita. They squeezed so much lime in it that, the bitter taste of lemon zest was dominating the drink. At one point we couldn't drink - as it was awfully bitter

3. Noise from the music system
There was live music going on. We like the songs but not the noise coming from the speakers

4. The only part that we like was meat - Chicken Picante

data.title: Excellent Argentenian Meal
data.text: I ate dinner at Gaucho Grill and I was very pleasantly surprised.  The staff was as attentive and friendly as can be and the food was incredible.  My dad who is a steak aficionado had the and I quote "best rib eye steak he has ever had".  My mom had a skirt steak that she loved and I had two incredible filet mignon medallions.  The sangria was excellent and the pancakes with dulce de leche was perfect.  I give this restaurant my highest recommendation and will make it a point to come back the next time I am in California.

data.title: Simply Specular
data.text: The only word to describe this restaurant is "Specular" The bone in rib steak was the best I ever had. The meat was well aged and very tender. Likewise was the skirt steak and the fillet. If you are ever in Long Beach dont miss this Argentinan restaurant

data.title: It seems that you take your chances
data.text:
My wife and I had dinner at the Gaucho Grill twice last week while on a pre-cruise visit to Long Beach.  The first night she had the chicken and beef skewers with a beer, while I had a lemon herb chicken dish.  Both dinners were excellent, the service was fine and the covered patio on the street provided a nice ambience.

We were so impressed with the restaurant that we returned the next night.  Both our previous meals had been so good that we each ordered exactly the same again (yes, I know - not very adventurous).  My wife's skewers were served this time with the chicken so underdone that it was deep pink and cold on the inside and she of course asked the waiter to change it for a skewer properly cooked.  The waiter took her entire plate and returned after ten minutes with chicken dry, hard as a rock and pretty much inedible.

Meanwhile, my chicken came equally dry and tough, but looking at my wife's raw chicken I decided to make the best of it.  The final straw came when the bill came with a charge for three beers, instead of the two that we were served.  When I pointed this out to the waiter he pretended to not understand and brought over the manager/owner.  He apologized for the overcharge and for the whole meal but didn't offer anything further (which we certainly didn't want anyway).

So it seems that you take your chances at the Gaucho.  One of our evenings was great, the other terrible.  We won't be back for the tie-breaker.

data.title: Simply Superb!
data.text: This was the second time we visited in our short stay to Long Beach - why - well bacause it is a really great quality restaurant. The first evening I needed some simple tasty food having not been very well - and I got it - the steak was excellent! The second time we came was because the first time was soooo good. The second time was outstanding. The food really is superb - so well cooked, seasoning perfect and so tasty. It is such a relief to eat here without fried food. The staff are lovely, attentive and caring about their customers and the entertainment - a delightful young man on guitar with melodious Spanish songs totally matched the atmosphere. The host recognised us and treated us to a complimentary desert - caramel pudding  and a crepe - unbelievably delicious. We had a lovely, lovely evening and would most definitely come again. It is perhaps the only restaurant ever that has made me want to visit a country but seeing pictures on the screens of Argentina and the most amazing tangos, peoples and landscapes has certainly opened that door. This is a most definite MUST restaurant for downtown Long Beach!

data.title: Excellent Argentinian restaurant in Long Beach
data.text: I wanted to try something different, and this restaurant fit the bill.  They had a very nice selection of drinks (I had the excellent sangria), and a variety of specialties.  The appetizers and salad were really tasty, and my skirt steak was very delicious.  We also enjoyed the dessert flan.  This is an excellent restaurant if you like Argentinian food (or want to try it).

data.title: The food was great but the service was better
data.text: First time we ate here and it was great! Its supposed to be an Argentine style grill and just about everything we tried was delicious. The bread they served as the appetizer was pretty good too. The food was a bit pricey but then it is an upscale restaurant. What stood out most was the service. Our waitress was very friendly and explained the menu to us. The owner was also very nice. He came out to talk to us and even gave the kids some toys. We will definetly come here again.

data.title: Amazing carnivores meal!
data.text: If you love meat, this is the place to go.  We started with Chorizo Argentine and Provolone for appetizers.  All I can say is yum!  Then the Parrillada as entree.  This was more than enough for our party of three (we have lunch for tomorrow).  The steak was a perfect medium rare.  The chicken was moist and tender.  We ordered the rice and grilled zucchini.  Both were fine, but the real star was the meat.  Dessert was a dol delech crepes and chocolate molten cakes.  Both wonderful.  Would definitely go back!

data.title: excellent restaurant
data.text: we visited this excellent restaurant on Pine Avenue twice during our stay in Long Beach - the food quality and service was as good as it gets - I especially recommend 'corderito' (lamb chops)probably the best I've had in a restaurant, the staff were extremely friendly, I have no hesitation in recommending this wonderful eatery

data.title: Really good meat!
data.text:
It was my first time to this restaurant and I can tell you that the meat is very good, tender and great flavor! Customer service very good!! Staff is checking what is going on at your table, which to me is a good thing!
Restroom a bit dirty and no toilet paper when visited the room.
I will definitely go back for ire delicious food!

data.title: Delicous!
data.text:
I had dinner here while visiting my cousin who lives in Long Beach while since I was in Southern California on a business trip.  We were seated outside on a Friday evening and the restaurant was relatively busy.  The service was prompt and efficient and the only issue was out table was racking on its legs but the server adjusted a table leg and voila, we had a stable table.

The sweetbreads we shared as an appetizer were delicious and the my steak was delicious.  The portabella mushrooms with the steak were also flavorful and tender and I loved the grilled zucchini which was 1 of the side dishes.  The music in the background was pleasant and the atmosphere was inviting
